content: espeeder thanks so much for taking a look at this pattern espeeder thanks you for your interest and appreciates your efforts in helping him cover the world in adorable arachnids espeeder is a very basic amigurumi and requires only single_crochet single_crochet increase increase invisible decrease decrease binding off & weaving in basic sewing skills and a malevolent desire to combine the horror of an arachnid apocalypse with the inherent sweetness of amigurumi notes about licensing after purchasing this pattern you have the right to give away or sell your creations if you choose to sell them please mention me incandesio as the designer and i would love to see pictures of your finished works pattern notes each piece is worked in the round i leave insanely long ends when i bind off which makes assembly a little easier hook d 3 25mm gauge is not really an issue but nice tight stitches are work through the front and back of each stitch yarn sport weight less than 2 oz i used lily & cream cotton yarn in various colorways safety eyes 8 or 10 mm stuffing polyfill extras stitch markers if you use them i use a differently-colored piece of yarn to mark the first stitch of each row then pull it out as i start the next one if you can keep an accurate count in your head you really don t need them time espeeder s body and head take less than an hour his legs can be worked up even faster individually but unfortunately there are eight of the little suckers hang in there you can get through them all body 1 magic_ring 6 2 increase 12 3 single_crochet increase 18 4 single_crochet 2 increase 24 5 single_crochet 3 increase 30 6 single_crochet 30 7 single_crochet 3 decrease 24 8 single_crochet 2 decrease 18 stuff firmly 9 sc1 decrease 12 10 sc1 decrease 6 until binding off thread the end up through the side between row 5 & 6 this is where the head will be attached head 1 magic_ring 6 2 increase 12 3 single_crochet increase 18 4 single_crochet 2 increase 24 5 single_crochet 24 6 single_crochet 2 decrease 18 place eyes between row 3 & 4 7 single_crochet 1 decrease 12 stuff firmly 8 decrease 6 bind off and weave in end legs make 8 1 magic_ring 6 2 single_crochet 1 increase 9 3-7 single_crochet 9 bind off tighten the magic_ring as much as possible then weave in the ends of six legs leaving two working ends these will be the back legs one for each side three ends are woven in and will now be trimmed i left the red end out finishing thread a yarn needle with the working end of the body insert needle behind four stitches on the back of the head between row 3 & 4 and draw the working yarn through one stitch pull it tight and continue stitch head to the body three to four times and bind
